title: Congratulating Gerald Gotti upon the occasion of his retirement after many years of dedicated service in New York State law enforcement
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION congratulating Gerald Gotti upon the occasion of
his retirement after many years of dedicated service in New  York  State
law enforcement

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and honor
those distinguished officers and citizens who would devote themselves to
public  service,  demonstrating great courage and diligence in providing
for the care and welfare of the citizens of their communities  and  this
great Empire State; and
  WHEREAS,  Within  every  community  of the State of New York there are
certain individuals who, by virtue of their commitment  and  dedication,
command  the  respect  and admiration of their community for their exem-
plary contributions and service on behalf of others; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to congratulate  Gerald
Gotti  upon the occasion of his retirement after many years of dedicated
service in New York State law enforcement; this auspicious occasion will
be celebrated on Saturday, February 5, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, From November  1985  through  June  1989,  Gerald  Gotti  was
employed as a Corrections Officer by the Oneida County Sheriff's Depart-
ment; and
  WHEREAS,  Leaving  his  employment  with  the  Oneida County Sheriff's
Department in order to  continue  his  career  in  New  York  State  law
enforcement,  Gerald  Gotti  was a Corrections Officer with the New York
State Department of Corrections from June 1989 until his  retirement  on
January 31, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  For  many  years, Gerald Gotti served both the Oneida County
Sheriff's Department and New York State Department of  Corrections  with
distinction; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1986, Gerald Gotti received the Rookie of the Year Award
for his service with the Oneida County Sheriff's Department as a  result
of  his  exceptional  performance  on  Thanksgiving Day in preventing an
inmate suicide at the Oneida County jail; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that those dedicated
public servants who unselfishly devote their lives to  the  preservation
of order and the protection of others are worthy and due full praise for
their commitment and noble endeavors; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Gerald Gotti upon the occasion of his retirement after many
years of dedicated service in New York State law enforcement; and be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Gerald Gotti.
